greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: A(n,k) is the n-th Fibonacci number with exactly k prime factors (counted with multiplicity); square array A(n,k), n>=1, k>=1, read by antidiagonals.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Antidiagonals n = 1..16, flattened
maple: A:= proc() local h, p, q; p, q:= proc() [] end, 2;
mathematica: A[n_, k_] := Module[{F = Fibonacci, h, p, q = 2}, p[_] = {}; While[ Length[p[k]] < n, q = q+1; h = PrimeOmega[F[q]]; p[h] = Append[p[h], F[q]]]; p[k][[n]]];
Table[Table[A[n, 1+d-n], {n, 1, d}], {d, 1, 10}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Feb 05 2021, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Apr 19 2018
